flawed_nl_solution:
The quilt is made of 16 squares on one side and 16 on the other so 16+16 = <<16+16=36>>36 squares total
She has already sewn 25% of the quilt so she has sown together 0.25*36 = <<25*0.01*36=9>>9 squares
Betsy still has 36-9 = <<36-9=27>>27 more squares to sew together
#### 27

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 36. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
